Key Arguments: Scientific issues require debate and empirical evidence, not consensus or government decree.
Minority opinions in science, which may initially be unpopular, can eventually be proven correct.
The proposed legislation could stifle scientific debate and progress.
Facts that contradict government policies might be labeled as misinformation or disinformation under the new legislation.
Notable Quotes: It would be contrary to scientific progress if debate were to be stifled by the proposed legislation.

It is an irrefutable fact that there is no empirical proof that carbon dioxide causes climate change or that Covid vaccination prevents transmission of the virus, but stating such facts could be construed under the proposed legislation as being harmful.
“(If) liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.” U.S.A. Justice Neil Gorsuch
